description: A five-slide presentation with key information about the Lion.
title: All About the Lion

slides.title: Introduction to the Lion
slides.content: The lion (Panthera leo) is one of the five big cats in the genus Panthera and a member of the Felidae family. Known as the 'King of the Jungle,' lions are the only cats that live in large social groups called prides.

slides.title: Physical Characteristics
content: Adult male lions can weigh up to 420 pounds and measure up to 10 feet in length including their tail.
They are sexually dimorphic, with males having prominent manes that grow with age and testosterone levels.

slides.title: Social Structure and Behavior
content: Lions live in groups called prides, typically consisting of related females, their cubs, and a small number of adult males.
Female lions do most of the hunting, working together to bring down large prey like zebras, wildebeest, and antelopes.

slides.title: Habitat and Distribution
content: Lions once roamed most of Africa and parts of Asia and Europe, but now they are found mainly in sub-Saharan Africa.
They prefer grasslands, savannas, and open woodlands where they can hunt effectively and find shelter.

slides.title: Conservation Status
content: Lions are classified as vulnerable by the IUCN, with populations declining due to habitat loss, human-wildlife conflict, and poaching.
Conservation efforts include protected areas, anti-poaching initiatives, and community-based conservation programs.
